content: ash & snow tunisian baby blanket introduction the ash & snow baby blanket was inspired by the winter skies here in bavaria soft white evokes freshly fallen snow while gentle ash reflects the muted tones of the winter sky i designed this blanket to be cozy timeless and easy to adapt combining texture and color with the simplicity of tunisian crochet this is my very first published pattern and i m so excited to share it with you if you notice anything that could be clarified or improved please don t hesitate to reach out i d love your feedback i hope it brings as much warmth and joy to those who use it as it did to me while making it thank you kindly materials ● diy handmade tilly tweed yarn 8 wpi / 260 m ○ color a grey 2 balls / approx 520 m ○ color b white 1 ball / approx 260 m this is an aran weight yarn purchased from tedi in germany feel free to substitute with any aran weight yarn you have available if substituting be sure to check gauge or measure as you go ● tunisian crochet hook 9 mm ● crochet hook 6 mm to create the border ● crochet hook 10 mm optional for foundation chain i prefer to start with a foundation chain one hook size larger than the main hook this makes working into the chains easier and creates a more flexible edge ● yarn needle gauge 9 sts and 9 row = 4 x 4 10 cm x 10 cm measured after blocking gauge is not critical for this project finished measurements may vary depending on yarn choice and gauge abbreviations ● chain - chain ● tfs - tunisian full stitch ● half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet ● sts - stitches ● slip_stitch - slip_stitch ● rs - right side this whole pattern will be worked rs only notes ● stitch count should remain 62 stitches throughout ● be sure to count stitches regularly if the space between the first two stitches is not skipped on alternating row increases will occur and the blanket will begin to flare ● if you are unfamiliar with the tunisian full stitch there are many helpful tutorials available online toni from tl yarn crafts has especially clear demonstrations instructions foundation using color a chain 62 my starting chain measured 28 wide row 1 forward pass working into the back bumps of the foundation chain insert the hook into the second chain from the hook and pull up a loop pull up a loop in each chain across keeping all loops on the hook 62 loops return pass yarn over and pull through one loop chain one equivalent *yarn over and pull through two loops * repeat from * to * until only one loop remains on the hook 62 sts row 2 forward pass work tfs pull up a loop in the space between the first two sts *pull up a loop in
